action.action-desc: Mr. Kiley of California (for himself and Mr. Owens) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require public institutions of higher education, as a condition of participating in programs under title IV of such Act, to provide a written statement and educational programming to new students on the rights of students under the first amendment to the Constitution.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Free Speech On Campus Act.

section.header: Program participation agreement on freedom of expression
section.text: Section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1094(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of a public institution, the institution will carry out each of the following:

subparagraph.text: At each orientation for new and transfer students, provide students attending the orientation—

subclause.text: explains the rights of students under the first amendment to the Constitution;
affirms the importance and the commitment of the institution to freedom of expression; and

includes assurances that students, and individuals invited by students to speak at the institution, will not be treated in a manner that violates the freedom of expression of such students or individuals; and

clause.text: educational programming (including online resources) that include each of the following:

subclause.text: Descriptions of policies, procedures, and protocols of the institution that protect freedom of expression and prohibit exclusionary behavior.

item.text: teach and encourage the expression of a wide range of views in a productive and respectful manner; and
include an understanding of the first amendment to the Constitution and its role in supporting the commitment of the institution to freedom of expression.

subparagraph.text: Post on the publicly accessible website of the institution the statement described in subparagraph (A)(i).
